channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2002] Ladies, this is what we're actually reading.
item.description: And guys... You see? It's not our fault.

item.title: [+1827] Internet Explorer is Useful. That is All [Pic]
[+1268] Vietnam, 35 years later (PICS)
item.description: Last Friday, April 30th, was the 35th anniversary of the Fall of Saigon and the end of the Vietnam War, and last Tuesday, May 4th, was the 40th anniversary of the shooting of protesting students at Kent State University.

item.title: [+1061] The following email was sent to our employees today
item.description: This morning we faced the difficult task of reducing our team by about 10%. This was an emotional and rough morning for everyone involved.

item.title: [+945] This is the face of a guy who steals from his friends
item.description: James S. Harris, 20, was attending a party at a friend's home in Platte City, Missouri when he suddenly got the bright idea to steal their stuff. Why? Because that's just the kind of friend James Harris is. Unfortunately, for Harris, he got caught trying to steal their stereo equipment...

item.title: [+928] Proof that "A + B = C"
[+911] Facebook's Gone Rogue; It's Time for an Open Alternative
item.description: Facebook has gone rogue, drunk on founder Mark Zuckerberg’s dreams of world domination. It’s time the rest of the web ecosystem recognizes this and works to replace it with something open and distributed.

item.title: [+882] I was told to wear a headscarf and I did
[+821] Dear Marvel: Iron Man 3 Needs To Be Demon In A Bottle
item.description: "Iron Man 3: Demon in a Bottle" would be a classic movie, not just a classic superhero movie. You just have to have the balls to make it.

item.title: [+709] 5 Insane File Sharing Panics from Before the Internet
item.description: Media piracy has been rampant throughout history... probably since the first guy to smear his feces on the wall in the shape of a buffalo turned around and immediately saw 50 more just like it being smeared on the walls behind him.

item.title: [+681] 61 terrible videogame shirts you must never wear
item.description: Only put these on these if you want to look like a sexless nerd and/or a douche

item.title: [+639] 43 ways to ruin your finances by age 30
item.description: Hopefully, sharing a few of these bad money moves will prevent others from doing the same.

item.title: [+618] Jailbroken iPad Runs SNES Emulator with WiiMote Controls
item.description: If you’ve got a jailbroken iPad, a copy of snes4iphone, and a WiiMote, have I got a doozy for you - check out the video.

item.title: [+542] Dan Fanelli's Racial Profiling Political Ad (Video)
[+504] This Is What Travelling Feels Like These Days
[+503] New hard drive write method packs in one terabyte per inch
item.description: Researchers describe a way to combine two hard drive writing methods to store data at densities of up to one terabyte per square inch, and suggest the media could be stable up to ten terabytes per square inch.

item.title: [+490] Epic Fail [Comic]
[+481] Conan at Google: The World has Completely Changed [Vid]
item.description: Rounding out an unofficial tour of Silicon Valley, Conan O'Brien visited Google's Mountain View headquarters on Wednesday, ribbing Google VP of Engineering Vic Gundotra about the company's infamous aloofness: "You guys are so power mad here at Google, You're such entitled A-holes. Hey, Conan's in the area, make him come by... Do a dance."

item.title: [+481] Privacy No Longer Exists... (PIC)
item.description: Apparently you can't even shit in peace anymore!

item.title: [+461] Posthumanity (PICS)
item.description: Canadian geek artist Steve Mann has augmented his vision with wearable computers for most of his life. He invented his 'smart pants' in high school, perfected his body tech rig at MIT, and now has one eye that's a camera.
